FuncDef: The display clock cesacr command displays the attributes, status, and configurations of a CES ACR clock reference source.
CLIs: display clock source cesacr slot <slotid> card <cardid> recovery-domain <domain-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the number of the clock recovery domain from which a clock source is extracted.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8.
The value ranges from 1 to 4 of the 16 E1 subcard.The value of the former 16 interfaces of the 32 E1 subcard ranges from 1 to 4, and of the latter 16 interfaces ranges from 5 to 8.

Displays the attributes of all clock sources.
-

Specify slot id.
The value is a string of 1 to 16, not case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display clock source cesacr slot 1 card 1 recovery-domain 2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The attributes of a CES ACR clock reference source include the priority, SSM level, reference source status, and bundling group. To query attributes or configurations of a CES ACR clock reference clock, run the display clock cesacr command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
